learning_outcomes.description: Explore the role of the midwife in providing woman centred inter-professional care including those requiring drug therapy during pregnancy, birth, and the postnatal period.

Exemplify and utilise available technologies to fulfil clinical requirements for attainment of midwifery practice and continuity of care experiences through recruitment, partnership, and development of effective relationships with women and the healthcare team.

Explain the legal and professional responsibilities, and the frameworks for safe midwifery practice including knowledge of scope of practice and the need to accept accountability and responsibility for safe drug administration.

Explain and demonstrate beginning level midwifery practice skills including monitoring and care of the woman and her baby's health, wellbeing, and responses to implemented care including administration of drugs in pregnancy, labour and birth, and the postpartum period.

Interpret how personal beliefs and the philosophy of woman centred care reflect continued enhancement of ethical decision making in the context of physical, psychological, and culturally responsive midwifery practice.

assessments.due_date:
Med+Safe to be completed in Week 3.

Completion of the Skill and Mid-point AMSAT will occur at approximately halfway (60 hours) of the student's placement. This includes in-semester and out of semester placements.

All requirements must be submitted and met to complete this assessment which contributes to passing the course.
assessments.category: Notebook/ Logbook, Participation/ Student contribution, Placement, Practical/ Demonstration, Portfolio, Quiz, Reflection
assessments.task_description:
This assessment task comprises of three (3) parts which will examine and extend your preparedness for clinical placement and development in the first half of the semester.

Part 1 – Medication safety

This assessment task requires the student to undertake an online assessment on medication safety as well as completion of a drug calculations assessment.

Students must receive a 100% pass mark to be able to pass this assessment. Further instructions can be found in the assessment task and via the BlackBoard site .

Part 2 - Skill Assessment

This assessment requires demonstration to perform a range of skills required for competent and safe midwifery practice. The aim of this task is to actively seek feedback about your practice, and evaluate your own performance to plan for improvements.

Part 3 - Demonstrated capability in clinical practice commensurate with the MIDW1105 Course Learning Objectives evidenced by completion and submission of the Australian Midwifery Standards Assessment Tool (AMSAT)

The Mid-point AMSAT must be completed in Myprogress ePAD and signed by your Practice Educator/ Clinical Facilitator OR Preceptor Midwife.

Completion due date is mid placement (approx. 60 hours of the student's placement) - complete Standards 1, 2, and 3 only

For all parts, please access the task description in the blackboard site for more information.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Students are required to upload their completed Med+Safe certificates to the companion blackboard site under Assessments.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.due_date:
The due date for this assessment is based upon your clinical placement start date with the assessment being due by the Friday of your final week of placement. This assessment requires the completion of Skills, Final AMSAT, and MPE and CoCE. This includes in-semester and out of semester placements.

All requirements must be submitted and met in order to complete this assessment which contributes to passing the course.
assessments.category: Notebook/ Logbook, Participation/ Student contribution, Placement, Practical/ Demonstration, Portfolio, Reflection
assessments.task_description:
This assessment requires you to demonstrate successful completion of clinical placement. There are three (3) parts to this assessment:

Part 1 - Skill Assessment

This assessment requires demonstration to perform a range of skills required for competent and safe midwifery practice. The aim of this task is to actively seek feedback about your practice, and evaluate your own performance to plan for improvements.

Part 2 - Demonstrated capability in clinical practice commensurate with the MIDW1105 Course Learning Objectives evidenced by completion and submission of the Australian Midwifery Standards Assessment Tool (AMSAT)

The Final AMSAT must be completed in Myprogress ePAD and signed by your Practice Educator/ Clinical Facilitator OR Preceptor Midwife.

Completion due date is at the end of your placement (around 120 hours) - complete Standards 1, 2, and 3 only

Part 3 - Completion and upload of required Midwifery Practice Experiences (MPE) including Continuity of Care Experiences (CoCE).

This assessment requires the student to upload at least 30 MPE and recruit at least one (1) CoCE.

For all parts, please access the task description in the blackboard site for more information.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Students are to complete their Skills and Final AMSAT via their ePAD.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.due_date:
End of Semester Exam Period

8/11/2025 - 22/11/2025

Examination Period. Students will be allocated to a date and time by the course coordinator.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 11(28 Jul - 19 Oct)
learning_activities.topic:
Clinical Based Learning Workshops (CBL)

Clinical skill development in a simulated learning environment. ATTENDANCE IS COMPULSORY.

Further details of each workshop can be found in Clinical Based learning on the companion Blackboard course.


Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Clinical Based Learning Workshops (CBL) Clinical skill development in a simulated learning environment. ATTENDANCE IS COMPULSORY . Further details of each workshop can be found in Clinical Based learning on the companion Blackboard course.

learning_activities.topic:
MIDW1105 Clinical Midwifery Practice 2

Clinical practice attendance at allocated hospital. Completion of all fifteen (15) clinical practice shifts or 120 hours of clinical practice is COMPULSORY. Students will be complete a placement as in semester or out of semester placement, as allocated by the Practice Education Team.

Learning outcomes: L03
learning_activities.topic_description: MIDW1105 Clinical Midwifery Practice 2 Clinical practice attendance at allocated hospital. Completion of all fifteen (15) clinical practice shifts or 120 hours of clinical practice is COMPULSORY . Students will be complete a placement as in semester or out of semester placement, as allocated by the Practice Education Team.
